page.title: 09Breamish Valley Pottery
page.content:
Situated in the village of Branton, itself, is Breamish Valley Pottery.It was opened in 1976.It makes mainly domestic ware - casseroles, jugs, mugs, serving dishes,salad bowls etc. All the pots are raw glazed and fired with a mixture of wood and oil to 1300 degrees Centigrade in a 75 cubic ft. kiln constructed of fire bricks.
The pottery is situated in an old farm building which was originally used for working horses.The building is constructed of a mixture of river stone and locally quarried stone.
The pottery is open from 9.30 a.m. to 6 p.m.-but closed on Sundays. The busiest time is during the Summer holidays. The pottery was started by Alastair Hardy who works alone with the occasional student.
